com.vernalis.pdbconnector2.query.text.fields

Class QueryFieldRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.pdbconnector2.query.text.fields.QueryFieldRegistry

  • public final class QueryFieldRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    Registry of query fields, loaded from a static JSON definition file via PdbStaticSchemaLoader This class is a singleton which should be accessed via the static accessor method getInstance()
    Since:
    1.28.0
    Author:
    S.Roughley knime@vernalis.com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String errorMessage() 
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Collection<NestedDropdownTextField.MenuAction>> getActionMap() 
      java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> getCategories() 
      java.lang.String getCategoryForId(java.lang.String id) 
      QueryField getDefault() 
      QueryField getField(java.lang.String uniqueID) 
      java.util.SortedSet<QueryField> getFields(java.lang.String category) 
      static QueryFieldRegistry getInstance() 
      boolean isOK() 
      void reload()
      Method to reload the definitions.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static QueryFieldRegistry getInstance()
        Returns:
        the singleton instance, which will be instantiated on first access. Error-free loading should be checked by calling isOK() before using

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Method to reload the definitions. If an error occurs, this is caught and should be checked via a call to isOK()

      • isOK

        public boolean isOK()
        Returns:
        true if no exceptions where thrown during loading. If an exception was thrown, its message can be accessed via errorMessage()

      • errorMessage

        public java.lang.String errorMessage()
        Returns:
        The message of the exception thrown during loading, or null if loading was successful.
        See Also:
        isOK()

      • getCategories

        public java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> getCategories()
        Returns:
        a SortedSet of the categories

      • getFields

        public java.util.SortedSet<QueryField> getFields(java.lang.String category)
                                          throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Parameters:
        category - The category to return the fields for
        Returns:
        A SortedSet of the fields for the categories
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the category does not exist

      • getField

        public QueryField getField(java.lang.String uniqueID)
        Parameters:
        uniqueID - The field unique ID
        Returns:
        The field (or null if no field is found for the ID)

      • getCategoryForId

        public java.lang.String getCategoryForId(java.lang.String id)
                                  throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Parameters:
        id - The field ID
        Returns:
        The category ID which contains the field
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no field with the ID is registered

      • getActionMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Collection<NestedDropdownTextField.MenuAction>> getActionMap()
        Returns:
        A Map of NestedDropdownTextField.MenuActions for the categories and fields. The map keys are the Category names, the values are a collection of MenuActions for each field

      • getDefault

        public QueryField getDefault()
        Returns:
        the default QueryField
